 29
 30/// Enum to indicate that an Applied_layout or Rt_layout object
 31/// will not be used and therefor should not be initialized when
 32/// constructed.
 33enum empty_layout_type { empty_layout };
 34
 35
 36
 37/// Class to represent either a interleaved-pointer or a split-pointer.
 38///
 39/// Primary definition handles non-complex types.  Functions
 40/// corresponding to split-pointer cause a runtime error, since
 41/// "split" does not make sense for non-complex types.
 42template <typename T>
 43class Rt_pointer
 44{
 45  // Constructors
 46public:
 47  // Default constructor creates a NULL pointer.
 48  Rt_pointer() : ptr_(0) {}
 49
 50  Rt_pointer(T* ptr) : ptr_(ptr) {}
 51  Rt_pointer(std::pair<T*, T*> const&) { assert(0); }
 52
 53
 54  // Accessors.
 55public:
 56  T*               as_real() { return ptr_; }
 57  T*               as_inter() { return ptr_; }
 58  std::pair<T*,T*> as_split() { assert(0); return std::pair<T*,T*>(0,0); }
 59
 60  bool is_null() { return ptr_ == 0; }
 61
 62  // Member data.
 63private:
 64  T* ptr_;
 65};
 66
 67
 68
 69/// Specialization for complex types.  Whether a Rt_pointer refers to a
 70/// interleaved or split pointer is determined by the using code.
 71/// (However, when initializing an interleaved pointer, `ptr1_` is set
 72/// to 0).
 73template <typename T>
 74class Rt_pointer<complex<T> >
 75{
 76  // Constructors.
 77public:
 78  // Default constructor creates a NULL pointer.
 79  Rt_pointer() : ptr0_(0), ptr1_(0) {}
 80
 81  Rt_pointer(complex<T>* ptr)
 82    : ptr0_(reinterpret_cast<T*>(ptr)), ptr1_(0)
 83  {}
 84
 85  Rt_pointer(std::pair<T*, T*> const& ptr)
 86    : ptr0_(ptr.first), ptr1_(ptr.second)
 87  {}
 88
 89  // Acccessors
 90public:
 91  T*               as_real() { assert(0); return 0; }
 92  complex<T>*       as_inter() { return reinterpret_cast<complex<T>*>(ptr0_); }
 93  std::pair<T*, T*> as_split() { return std::pair<T*,T*>(ptr0_, ptr1_); }
 94
 95  bool is_null() { return ptr0_ == 0; }
 96
 97  // Member data.
 98private:
 99  T* ptr0_;
100  T* ptr1_;
101};
102
103
104
105/// Runtime dimension-order (corresponds to compile-time tuples).
106///
107/// Member names are chosen to correspond to tuple's.
108///
109class Rt_tuple
110{
111  // Constructors.
112public:
113  Rt_tuple()
114    : impl_dim0(0), impl_dim1(1), impl_dim2(2)
115  {}
116
117  Rt_tuple(dimension_type d0, dimension_type d1, dimension_type d2)
118    : impl_dim0(d0), impl_dim1(d1), impl_dim2(d2)
119  {}
120
121  // Convenience constructor from a compile-time tuple.
122  template <dimension_type D0,
123	    dimension_type D1,
124	    dimension_type D2>
125  Rt_tuple(tuple<D0, D1, D2>)
126    : impl_dim0(D0), impl_dim1(D1), impl_dim2(D2)
127  {}
128
129  // Member data.
130public:
131  dimension_type impl_dim0;
132  dimension_type impl_dim1;
133  dimension_type impl_dim2;
134};
135
136
137
138struct Any_type;
139
140
141/// Stride_unknown indicates that at compile-time, minor dimension
142/// stride is unknown.
143struct Stride_unknown
144{ static bool const is_ct_unit_stride = false; };
145
146/// Stride_unit indicates that at compile-time, minor dimension is
147/// known to be unit-stride.
148struct Stride_unit
149{ static bool const is_ct_unit_stride = true; };
150
151/// Stride_unit_dense indicates that at compile-time, minor dimension
152/// is known to be unit-stride and major dimensions are known to be
153/// dense (contiguous).
154struct Stride_unit_dense
155{ static bool const is_ct_unit_stride = true; };
156
157/// Stride_unit_align indicates that at compile-time, minor dimension
158/// is known to be unit-stride and major dimensions are known to
159/// start on aligned boundaries.
160template <unsigned Align> struct Stride_unit_align
161{ static bool const is_ct_unit_stride = true; };
162
163
164/// Runtime packing format enum.
165enum rt_pack_type
166{
167  stride_unknown,
168  stride_unit,
169  stride_unit_dense,
170  stride_unit_align
171};
172
173template <typename PackFmt>
174struct Is_stride_unit_align
175{
176  static bool     const value = false;
177  static unsigned const align = 0;
178};
179
180template <unsigned Align>
181struct Is_stride_unit_align<Stride_unit_align<Align> >
182{
183  static bool     const value = true;
184  static unsigned const align = Align;
185};
186
187
188
189/// Cmplx_inter_fmt indicates that complex data is stored as an
190/// array of type complex, which is assumed to be interleaved.
191struct Cmplx_inter_fmt {};
192/// Cmplx_split_fmt indicates that complex data is stored in
193/// separate arrays of real and imaginary data.
194struct Cmplx_split_fmt {};
195
196/// Runtime complex format enum.
197enum rt_complex_type
198{
199  cmplx_split_fmt,
200  cmplx_inter_fmt
201};
202
203
204
205/// Validity check for packing format tags.
206template <typename T>
207struct Valid_pack_type;
208
209template <> struct Valid_pack_type<Any_type> {};
210template <> struct Valid_pack_type<Stride_unit> {};
211template <> struct Valid_pack_type<Stride_unit_dense> {};
212template <> struct Valid_pack_type<Stride_unknown> {};
213template <unsigned Align> struct Valid_pack_type<Stride_unit_align<Align> > {};
214
215
216
217/// Validity check for complex format tags.
218template <typename T>
219struct Valid_complex_fmt;
220
221template <> struct Valid_complex_fmt<Any_type> {};
222template <> struct Valid_complex_fmt<Cmplx_inter_fmt> {};
223template <> struct Valid_complex_fmt<Cmplx_split_fmt> {};
224
225
226
227/// Validity check for dimension-ordering tuples.
228template <typename T>
229struct Valid_order;
230
231template <> struct Valid_order<Any_type> {};
232template <dimension_type Dim0,
233	  dimension_type Dim1,
234	  dimension_type Dim2>
235struct Valid_order<tuple<Dim0, Dim1, Dim2> > {};
236
237
238
239
240/// Layout tuple groups a block's (compile-time) data layout information.
241///
242/// Template parameters:
243///   :D: The block's dimension.
244///   :Order: The dimension ordering (`tuple<0, 1, 2>`, `row2_type`, etc.)
245///   :PackType: One of `Stride_unit`, `Stride_unit_dense`,
246///              `Stride_unit_align` <...>, `Stride_unknown`.
247///   :ComplexType: Either `Cmplx_inter_fmt` or `Cmplx_split_fmt`
248template <dimension_type D,
249	  typename       Order,
250	  typename       PackType,
251	  typename	 ComplexType = Cmplx_inter_fmt>
252struct Layout : Valid_pack_type<PackType>,
253                Valid_order<Order>
254#if !(defined(__GNUC__) && __GNUC__ < 4)
255  // G++ 3.4.4 enters an infinite loop processing this compile-time
256  // assertion (060505).  G++ 4.1 is OK.
257  , Valid_complex_fmt<ComplexType>
258#endif
259{
260  static dimension_type const dim = D;
261  typedef PackType    pack_type;
262  typedef Order       order_type;
263  typedef ComplexType complex_type;
264};
265
266
267
268/// Runtime layout class encapsulating:
269///  - Dimension,
270///  - Dimension ordering,
271///  - Packing format,
272///  - Complex format.
273template <dimension_type Dim>
274struct Rt_layout
275{
276  // Dimension is fixed at compile-time.
277  static dimension_type const dim = Dim;
278
279  // Run-time layout.
280  rt_pack_type      pack;
281  Rt_tuple          order;
282  rt_complex_type   complex;
283  unsigned          align;	// Only valid if pack == stride_unit_align
284
285
286  // Construct an empty Rt_layout object.
287  Rt_layout() {}
288
289  Rt_layout(
290    rt_pack_type    a_pack,
291    Rt_tuple const& a_order,
292    rt_complex_type a_complex,
293    unsigned        a_align)
294  : pack    (a_pack),
295    order   (a_order),
296    complex (a_complex),
297    align   (a_align)
298  {}
299
300
301};
302
303
304
305/// Applied_layout takes the layout policies encapsulated by a
306/// Layout and applys them to map multi-dimensional indices into
307/// memory offsets.
308template <typename LP>
309struct Applied_layout;
310
311
312
313template <typename Order,
314	  typename ComplexLayout>
315class Applied_layout<Layout<1, Order, Stride_unit_dense, ComplexLayout> >
316{
317public:
318  static dimension_type const dim = 1;
319  typedef tuple<0, 1, 2>  order_type;
320  typedef Stride_unit_dense pack_type;
321  typedef ComplexLayout   complex_type;
322
323public:
324  Applied_layout(length_type size0)
325  {
326    size_[0] = size0;
327  }
328
329  template <typename ExtentT>
330  Applied_layout(ExtentT const& extent)
331  {
332    size_[0] = size_of_dim(extent, 0);
333  }
334
335  index_type index(index_type idx0)
336    const VSIP_NOTHROW
337  {
338    assert(idx0 < size_[0]);
339    return idx0;
340  }
341
342  index_type index(Index<1> idx)
343    const VSIP_NOTHROW
344    { return idx[0]; }
345
346  stride_type stride(dimension_type d)
347    const VSIP_NOTHROW
348    { assert(d <= dim); return 1; }
349
350  length_type size(dimension_type d)
351    const VSIP_NOTHROW
352    { assert(d <= dim); return size_[d]; }
353
354  length_type total_size()
355    const VSIP_NOTHROW
356    { return size_[0]; }
357
358private:
359  length_type size_[dim];
360};
361
362
363
364template <unsigned Align,
365	  typename Order,
366	  typename ComplexLayout>
367class Applied_layout<Layout<1, Order, Stride_unit_align<Align>, ComplexLayout> >
368{
369public:
370  static dimension_type const dim = 1;
371  typedef Order           order_type;
372  typedef Stride_unit_dense pack_type;
373  typedef ComplexLayout   complex_type;
374
375public:
376  Applied_layout(length_type size0)
377  {
378    size_[0] = size0;
379  }
380
381  template <typename ExtentT>
382  Applied_layout(ExtentT const& extent)
383  {
384    size_[0] = size_of_dim(extent, 0);
385  }
386
387  index_type index(index_type idx0)
388    const VSIP_NOTHROW
389  {
390    assert(idx0 < size_[0]);
391    return idx0;
392  }
393
394  index_type index(Index<1> idx)
395    const VSIP_NOTHROW
396    { return idx[0]; }
397
398  stride_type stride(dimension_type d)
399    const VSIP_NOTHROW
400    { assert(d <= dim); return 1; }
401
402  length_type size(dimension_type d)
403    const VSIP_NOTHROW
404    { assert(d <= dim); return size_[d]; }
405
406  length_type total_size()
407    const VSIP_NOTHROW
408    { return size_[0]; }
409
410private:
411  length_type size_[dim];
412};

420public:

446    const VSIP_NOTHROW

448

450    const VSIP_NOTHROW

454    const VSIP_NOTHROW

457  length_type total_size()
458    const VSIP_NOTHROW
459    { return size_[0]; }
460
461private:
462  length_type size_[dim];
463};

466
467template <typename ComplexLayout>
468class Applied_layout<Layout<2, tuple<0, 1, 2>, Stride_unit_dense, ComplexLayout> >
469{
470public:
471  static dimension_type const dim = 2;
472  typedef tuple<0, 1, 2>  order_type;
473  typedef Stride_unit_dense pack_type;
474  typedef ComplexLayout   complex_type;
475
476public:
477  Applied_layout(length_type size0, length_type size1)
478  {
479    size_[0] = size0;
480    size_[1] = size1;
481  }
482
483  template <typename ExtentT>
484  Applied_layout(ExtentT const& extent)
485  {
486    size_[0] = size_of_dim(extent, 0);
487    size_[1] = size_of_dim(extent, 1);
488  }
489
490  index_type index(index_type idx0, index_type idx1)
491    const VSIP_NOTHROW
492  {
493    assert(idx0 < size_[0] && idx1 < size_[1]);
494    return idx0 * size_[1] + idx1;
495  }
496
497  index_type index(Index<2> idx)
498    const VSIP_NOTHROW
499    { return idx[0] * size_[1] + idx[1]; }
500
501  stride_type stride(dimension_type d)
502    const VSIP_NOTHROW
503    { return d == 0 ? size_[1] : 1; }
504
505  length_type size(dimension_type d)
506    const VSIP_NOTHROW
507    { return size_[d]; }
508
509  length_type total_size()
510    const VSIP_NOTHROW
511    { return size_[1] * size_[0]; }
512
513private:
514  length_type size_[2];
515};
516
517
518
519template <typename ComplexLayout>
520class Applied_layout<Layout<2, tuple<1, 0, 2>, Stride_unit_dense, ComplexLayout> >
521{
522public:
523  static dimension_type const dim = 2;
524  typedef tuple<1, 0, 2>  order_type;
525  typedef Stride_unit_dense pack_type;
526  typedef ComplexLayout   complex_type;
527
528public:
529  Applied_layout(length_type size0, length_type size1)
530  {
531    size_[0] = size0;
532    size_[1] = size1;
533  }
534
535  template <typename ExtentT>
536  Applied_layout(ExtentT const& extent)
537  {
538    size_[0] = size_of_dim(extent, 0);
539    size_[1] = size_of_dim(extent, 1);
540  }
541
542  index_type index(index_type idx0, index_type idx1)
543    const VSIP_NOTHROW
544  {
545    assert(idx0 < size_[0] && idx1 < size_[1]);
546    return idx0 + idx1 * size_[0];
547  }
548
549  index_type index(Index<2> idx)
550    const VSIP_NOTHROW
551    { return idx[0] + idx[1] * size_[0]; }
552
553  stride_type stride(dimension_type d)
554    const VSIP_NOTHROW
555    { return d == 0 ? 1 : size_[0]; }
556
557  length_type size(dimension_type d)
558    const VSIP_NOTHROW
559    { return size_[d]; }
560
561  length_type total_size()
562    const VSIP_NOTHROW
563    { return size_[1] * size_[0]; }
564
565private:
566  length_type size_[2];
567};
568
569
570
571template <unsigned Align,
572	  typename ComplexLayout>
573class Applied_layout<Layout<2, tuple<0, 1, 2>, Stride_unit_align<Align>,
574			   ComplexLayout> >
575{
576public:
577  static dimension_type const dim = 2;
578  typedef tuple<0, 1, 2>         order_type;
579  typedef Stride_unit_align<Align> pack_type;
580  typedef ComplexLayout          complex_type;
581
582public:
583  Applied_layout(length_type size0, length_type size1)
584  {
585    size_[0] = size0;
586    size_[1] = size1;
587
588    stride_ = size_[1];
589
590    if (stride_ % Align != 0)
591      stride_ += (Align - stride_%Align);
592  }
593
594  template <typename ExtentT>
595  Applied_layout(ExtentT const& extent)
596  {
597    size_[0] = size_of_dim(extent, 0);
598    size_[1] = size_of_dim(extent, 1);
599
600    stride_ = size_[1];
601
602    if (stride_ % Align != 0)
603      stride_ += (Align - stride_%Align);
604  }
605
606  index_type index(index_type idx0, index_type idx1)
607    const VSIP_NOTHROW
608  {
609    assert(idx0 < size_[0] && idx1 < size_[1]);
610    return idx0 * stride_ + idx1;
611  }
612
613  index_type index(Index<2> idx)
614    const VSIP_NOTHROW
615    { return idx[0] * stride_ + idx[1]; }
616
617  stride_type stride(dimension_type d)
618    const VSIP_NOTHROW
619    { return d == 0 ? stride_ : 1; }
620
621  length_type size(dimension_type d)
622    const VSIP_NOTHROW
623    { return size_[d]; }
624
625  length_type total_size() const
626    { return stride_ * size_[0] - (stride_-size_[1]); }
627
628
629private:
630  length_type size_[2];
631  length_type stride_;
632};
633
634
635
636template <unsigned Align,
637	  typename ComplexLayout>
638class Applied_layout<Layout<2, tuple<1, 0, 2>, Stride_unit_align<Align>,
639			   ComplexLayout> >
640{
641public:
642  static dimension_type const dim = 2;
643  typedef tuple<1, 0, 2>           order_type;
644  typedef Stride_unit_align<Align> pack_type;
645  typedef ComplexLayout            complex_type;
646
647public:
648  Applied_layout(length_type size0, length_type size1)
649  {
650    size_[0] = size0;
651    size_[1] = size1;
652
653    stride_ = size_[1];
654
655    if (stride_ % Align != 0)
656      stride_ += (Align - stride_%Align);
657  }
658
659  template <typename ExtentT>
660  Applied_layout(ExtentT const& extent)
661  {
662    size_[0] = size_of_dim(extent, 0);
663    size_[1] = size_of_dim(extent, 1);
664
665    stride_ = size_[0];
666
667    if (stride_ % Align != 0)
668      stride_ += (Align - stride_%Align);
669  }
670
671  index_type index(index_type idx0, index_type idx1)
672    const VSIP_NOTHROW
673  {
674    assert(idx0 < size_[0] && idx1 < size_[1]);
675    return idx0 + idx1 * stride_;
676  }
677
678  index_type index(Index<2> idx)
679    const VSIP_NOTHROW
680    { return idx[0] + idx[1] * stride_; }
681
682  stride_type stride(dimension_type d)
683    const VSIP_NOTHROW
684    { return d == 1 ? stride_ : 1; }
685
686  length_type size(dimension_type d)
687    const VSIP_NOTHROW
688    { return size_[d]; }
689
690  length_type total_size() const
691    { return stride_ * size_[1] - (stride_-size_[0]); }
692
693
694private:
695  length_type size_[2];
696  length_type stride_;
697};
698
699
700
701template <dimension_type Dim0,
702	  dimension_type Dim1,
703	  dimension_type Dim2,
704	  typename       ComplexLayout>
705class Applied_layout<Layout<3, tuple<Dim0, Dim1, Dim2>, Stride_unit_dense,
706			   ComplexLayout> >
707{
708public:
709  static dimension_type const dim = 3;
710  typedef tuple<Dim0, Dim1, Dim2> order_type;
711  typedef Stride_unit_dense         pack_type;
712  typedef ComplexLayout           complex_type;
713
714public:
715  template <typename ExtentT>
716  Applied_layout(ExtentT const& extent)
717  {
718    size_[0] = size_of_dim(extent, 0);
719    size_[1] = size_of_dim(extent, 1);
720    size_[2] = size_of_dim(extent, 2);
721  }
722
723  index_type index(Index<3> idx)
724    const VSIP_NOTHROW
725  {
726    assert(idx[0] < size_[0] && idx[1] < size_[1] && idx[2] < size_[2]);
727    return idx[Dim0]*size_[Dim1]*size_[Dim2] +
728           idx[Dim1]*size_[Dim2] + 
729           idx[Dim2];
730  }
731
732  index_type index(index_type idx0, index_type idx1, index_type idx2)
733    const VSIP_NOTHROW
734    { return index(Index<3>(idx0, idx1, idx2)); }
735
736
737  stride_type stride(dimension_type d)
738    const VSIP_NOTHROW
739  {
740    return d == Dim2 ? 1 :
741           d == Dim1 ? size_[Dim2]
742                     : size_[Dim1] * size_[Dim2];
743
744  }
745
746  length_type size(dimension_type d)
747    const VSIP_NOTHROW
748    { return size_[d]; }
749
750  length_type total_size()
751    const VSIP_NOTHROW
752    { return size_[2] * size_[1] * size_[0]; }
753
754private:
755  length_type size_[3];
756};
757
758
759
760template <dimension_type Dim0,
761	  dimension_type Dim1,
762	  dimension_type Dim2,
763	  unsigned       Align,
764	  typename       ComplexLayout>
765class Applied_layout<Layout<3, tuple<Dim0, Dim1, Dim2>,
766			    Stride_unit_align<Align>,
767			    ComplexLayout> >
768{
769public:
770  static dimension_type const dim = 3;
771  typedef tuple<Dim0, Dim1, Dim2>  order_type;
772  typedef Stride_unit_align<Align> pack_type;
773  typedef ComplexLayout            complex_type;
774
775public:
776  template <typename ExtentT>
777  Applied_layout(ExtentT const& extent)
778  {
779    size_[0] = size_of_dim(extent, 0);
780    size_[1] = size_of_dim(extent, 1);
781    size_[2] = size_of_dim(extent, 2);
782
783    stride_[Dim2] = 1;
784    stride_[Dim1] = size_[Dim2];
785    if (stride_[Dim1] % Align != 0)
786      stride_[Dim1] += (Align - stride_[Dim1]%Align);
787    stride_[Dim0] = size_[Dim1] * stride_[Dim1];
788  }
789
790  index_type index(Index<3> idx)
791    const VSIP_NOTHROW
792  {
793    assert(idx[0] < size_[0] && idx[1] < size_[1] && idx[2] < size_[2]);
794    return idx[Dim0]*stride_[Dim0] +
795           idx[Dim1]*stride_[Dim1] + 
796           idx[Dim2];
797  }
798
799  index_type index(index_type idx0, index_type idx1, index_type idx2)
800    const VSIP_NOTHROW
801    { return index(Index<3>(idx0, idx1, idx2)); }
802
803  stride_type stride(dimension_type d)
804    const VSIP_NOTHROW
805  {
806    return stride_[d];
807  }
808
809  length_type size(dimension_type d)
810    const VSIP_NOTHROW
811  { return size_[d]; }
812
813  length_type total_size()
814    const VSIP_NOTHROW
815  { return size_[Dim0] * stride_[Dim0]; }
816
817private:
818  length_type size_  [3];
819  stride_type stride_[3];
820};
821
822
823
824/// Applied run-time layout.
825///
826/// This object gets created for run-time extdata access.
827///
828/// Efficiency is important to reduce library interface overhead.
829///  - Don't store the whole Rt_layout, only the parts we need:
830///    the complex_format and part of the dimension-order.
831///
832template <dimension_type Dim>
833class Applied_layout<Rt_layout<Dim> >
834{
835public:
836  static dimension_type const dim = Dim;
837
838public:
839  // Construct an empty Applied_layout.  Used when it is known that object
840  // will not be used.
841  Applied_layout(empty_layout_type) {}
842
843  /// Construct Applied_layout object.
844  ///
845  /// Template parameters:
846  ///
847  ///   :ExtentT: to be a type capable of encoding an extent (Length or Domain)
848  ///
849  /// Arguments:
850  ///
851  ///   :layout:    to be the run-time layout.
852  ///   :extent:    to be the extent of the data to layout.
853  ///   :elem_size: to be the size of a data element (in bytes).
854  template <typename ExtentT>
855  Applied_layout(
856    Rt_layout<Dim> const& layout,
857    ExtentT const&        extent,
858    length_type           elem_size = 1)
859  : cformat_(layout.complex)
860  {
861    assert(layout.pack != stride_unit_align || 
862           layout.align == 0 || layout.align % elem_size == 0);
863
864    for (dimension_type d=0; d<Dim; ++d)
865      size_[d] = size_of_dim(extent, d);
866
867    if (Dim == 3)
868    {
869      order_[2] = layout.order.impl_dim2;
870      order_[1] = layout.order.impl_dim1;
871      order_[0] = layout.order.impl_dim0;
872
873      stride_[order_[2]] = 1;
874      stride_[order_[1]] = size_[order_[2]];
875      if (layout.pack == stride_unit_align && 
876	  layout.align != 0 &&
877	  (elem_size*stride_[order_[1]]) % layout.align != 0)
878      {
879	stride_type adjust =
880	  layout.align - (stride_[order_[1]] * elem_size)%layout.align;
881	assert(adjust > 0 && adjust % elem_size == 0);
882	adjust /= elem_size;
883	stride_[order_[1]] += adjust;
884	assert((stride_[order_[1]] * elem_size)%layout.align == 0);
885      }
886      stride_[order_[0]] = size_[order_[1]] * stride_[order_[1]];
887    }
888    else if (Dim == 2)
889    {
890      // Copy only the portion of the dimension-order that we use.
891      order_[1] = layout.order.impl_dim1;
892      order_[0] = layout.order.impl_dim0;
893
894      stride_[order_[1]] = 1;
895      stride_[order_[0]] = size_[order_[1]];
896
897      if (layout.pack == stride_unit_align && 
898	  layout.align != 0 &&
899	  (elem_size*stride_[order_[0]]) % layout.align != 0)
900      {
901	stride_type adjust =
902	  layout.align - (stride_[order_[0]] * elem_size)%layout.align;
903	assert(adjust > 0 && adjust % elem_size == 0);
904	adjust /= elem_size;
905	stride_[order_[0]] += adjust;
906	assert((stride_[order_[0]] * elem_size)%layout.align == 0);
907      }
908    }
909    else  // (Dim == 1)
910    {
911      // Copy only the portion of the dimension-order that we use.
912      order_[0] = layout.order.impl_dim0;
913
914      stride_[0] = 1;
915    }
916  }
917
918  index_type index(Index<Dim> idx)
919    const VSIP_NOTHROW
920  {
921    if (Dim == 3)
922    {
923      assert(idx[0] < size_[0] && idx[1] < size_[1] && idx[2] < size_[2]);
924      return idx[order_[0]]*stride_[order_[0]] +
925	     idx[order_[1]]*stride_[order_[1]] + 
926	     idx[order_[2]];
927    }
928    else if (Dim == 2)
929    {
930      assert(idx[0] < size_[0] && idx[1] < size_[1]);
931      return idx[order_[0]]*stride_[order_[0]] +
932	     idx[order_[1]];
933    }
934    else // (Dim == 1)
935    {
936      assert(idx[0] < size_[0]);
937      return idx[0];
938    }
939  }
940
941  stride_type stride(dimension_type d)
942    const VSIP_NOTHROW
943  {
944    return stride_[d];
945  }
946
947  length_type size(dimension_type d)
948    const VSIP_NOTHROW
949  { return size_[d]; }
950
951  length_type total_size()
952    const VSIP_NOTHROW
953  { return size_[order_[0]] * stride_[order_[0]]; }
954
955public:
956  rt_complex_type cformat_;
957
958private:
959  dimension_type order_ [Dim];
960  length_type    size_  [Dim];
961  stride_type    stride_[Dim];
962};
963
964} // namespace vsip::impl
965} // namespace vsip
966
967#endif // VSIP_CORE_LAYOUT_HPP
Generated on Wed Sep 30 14:30:00 2009 by
synopsis (version 0.12)
